page.title: 12LOCAL LEGENDS
page.content: In 1696{a farmer}was on his way to{ {Macclesfield}to sell a{white horse.}On his way an old man stopped him and asked to buy it.The farmer refused, then the old man said he would not sell it at{the market}.It was true.On his way back from the market the old man stopped him again and took him to an old{rock face}.He tapped it with a staff and it opened.There lying on the cave floor was gold stacked in piles. The old man instructed the farmer to take what he wanted in return for his horse. Before he went, the farmer had a chance to see{King Arthur and his {knights}asleep.The old man has not been seen since. The Edge is also famous for its {witches}who are supposed to hold {covens,}especially on{Halloween night. After midnight people come from all around the district to see the sight.
